title: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: Bug 120922 - 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement. Other pages cannot be used until the source is saved. The user needs to figure out how to save or discard their changes. The prompt message asks 'Do you want to save the changes?'. The options are: 'Yes' to save the changes, 'No' to discard the changes, and 'Cancel' to do nothing and remain on the Source page. The dialog is titled 'Error' (including the quotes).
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that the changes need to be saved.
EB:
The dialog prompt and title need to be improved in the following ways: 
1. The prompt should clearly indicate that the XML Report Design has been changed.
2. The title of the dialog should not contain quotation marks.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open a report in the XML Report Designer.
2. Edit the XML in the 'source' view.
3. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
4. Observe the error message displaying the improper instructions and the dialog titled as 'Error'.
